JavaCSVReader

Class CSVFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • JavaCSVReader.CSVFile

  • public class CSVFile
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements a container for holding,reading, and writing CSV data
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Noah Harvey

      • name

        private java.lang.String name
        the name of the file (including any file extension)

      • headers

        private java.util.Vector headers
        the data headers contained in the file.


        This can be thought of as the spread sheets that are found in a file.
        Each vector contains an Object of type CSVDataHeader.

        See Also:
        CSVDataHeader

        private java.lang.String rawFileText

      • save

        public void save()
        Saves raw text to the file based on the data contained in the headers list.
        See Also:
        createRawText(), writeFileData(String)

      • parseFile

        public void parseFile(java.lang.String rawInput)
        Parse through the given text saving the given data into CSVDataHeaders


        This is done by reading through each line in the text (denoted by the value "\n") and parsing the data according to the first character in the line. If the character is one of the three delimiters then parse it accordingly. If it not skip it and move on.

        Parameters:
        rawInput - the raw text to parse - generally the value returned by readFileData().
        See Also:
        readFileData()

      • parseHeaderData

        private CSVDataHeader parseHeaderData(CSVDataHeader header,
                            java.lang.String rawText)
        Parse the given text and append it to the appropriate columns in the given CSVDataHeader.
        Parameters:
        header - the header to append the data to
        rawText - the raw text to parse
        Returns:
        the given header with the data appended to it
        See Also:
        CSVDataHeader.appendToColumn(String,int)

      • parseFileMetaData

        private void parseFileMetaData(java.lang.String text)
        Parse the given text to determine the delimiters for parsing the file


        view the README.txt for more details on file and text formatting

        Parameters:
        text - the raw text to use to parse for the delimiters. 
        This is normally the FIRST line in a file

      • createNewHeader

        private CSVDataHeader createNewHeader(java.lang.String rawText)
        Create new header from given text (should be two lines) each beginning with the headerDelimiter.


        view the README.txt for more details on file and text formatting

        Parameters:
        rawText - the rawText to parse for creating the new CSVDataHeader
        Returns:
        the new CSVDataHeader created based on the given text

        Parameters:
